result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey W. LORENZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay Supervision Fees in amount to be determined by DOC.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the Departments assessment process

Domestic violence assessment and completion of the Manitowoc  County Alternatives to Men's Absue Program.

timeConds.notes: Jail time stayed and to be imposed by order of the Court upon request by DOC agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey W. LORENZ

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 08-26-14 at 1:30 p.m.
Amended Information charges battery (DVO) contrary to Section 940.19(1) and 968.075(1)(a) of the Wisconsin Statutes.
Plea date is set for 08-26-14 at 1:30 p.m.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed charging one count of strangulation and suffocation, contrary to Section 940.235(1) of the Wisconsin Statutes.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 05-13-14 at 1:30 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 05-08-14 at 1:45 p.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of strangulation and suffocation.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-21-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no assaultive contact with Annette Delsman and that he maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
